# str_trunc

The function `stringr::str_trunc()` allows you to set the maximum number of characters strings can contain.
Strings that are longer will be truncated to the specified length.

[Tidyverse reference page](https://stringr.tidyverse.org/reference/str_flatten.html)


```{r}
#Create vector of strings with varying lengths
vec <- c("1", "to","four", "_eight_")
vec |> stringr::str_view()
```


```{r}
#Trunc to length of 3
vec |> stringr::str_trunc(3) |> stringr::str_view()
```
